title: Capacitors - speed vs t of particle between plates

content.description: At time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, a small particle with an initial velocity <math alttext="v sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math> in the <math alttext="positive x" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mpadded></math>-direction enters the region between two charged capacitor plates, as shown. The particle has positive charge <math alttext="positive Q sub p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>p</mi></msub></mstyle></math> and mass <math alttext="M sub p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>M</mi><mi>p</mi></msub></mstyle></math>, and the electric field between the plates is directed in the <math alttext="positive y" overflow="scroll"> <mpadded> <mo>+</mo> <mi>y</mi> </mpadded> </math>-direction with a magnitude <math alttext="E sub c" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>E</mi><mtext>c</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>. The particle passes through the region between the plates without contacting the plates.
content.question: If gravitational forces and capacitor edge effects are negligible, what is the particleâ€™s speed as a function of time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mi>t</mi> </mstyle> </math> during the time it is within the region between the plates?

choices.label: <math alttext="v sub 0, end sub, plus, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator E sub C, end sub, times Q sub p, and denominator M sub p, close parenthesis, times t" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>E</mi><mtext>c</mtext></msub><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>p</mi></msub></mrow><msub><mi>M</mi><mi>p</mi></msub></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>t</mi></math>

<math alttext="v sub 0 plus one half times, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator E sub C, end sub, times Q sub p, and denominator M sub p, close parenthesis, times t squared" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>E</mi><mtext>c</mtext></msub><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>p</mi></msub></mrow><msub><mi>M</mi><mi>p</mi></msub></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

<math alttext="the square root of v sub 0, end sub, squared plus, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator E sub C, end sub, times Q sub p, end sub, times t, and denominator M sub p, close parenthesis, squared, end root" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msqrt><msup><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>E</mi><mtext>c</mtext></msub><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>p</mi></msub><mi>t</mi></mrow><msub><mi>M</mi><mi>p</mi></msub></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></msqrt></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the square root of v sub 0, end sub, squared plus, open parenthesis, one half times the fraction with numerator E sub C, end sub, times Q sub p, end sub, times t squared, and denominator M sub p, close parenthesis, squared, end root" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msqrt><msup><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>E</mi><mtext>c</mtext></msub><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>p</mi></msub><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><msub><mi>M</mi><mi>p</mi></msub></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></msqrt></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the square root of v sub 0, end sub, squared plus, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator E sub C, end sub, times Q sub p, end sub, times t, and denominator M sub p, close parenthesis, squared, end root" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msqrt><msup><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>E</mi><mtext>c</mtext></msub><msub><mi>Q</mi><mi>p</mi></msub><mi>t</mi></mrow><msub><mi>M</mi><mi>p</mi></msub></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></msqrt></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
